sub_title: Drs., Art Scientist, ethnomusicologist, consultancy, musician; organ, harpsichord, choirmaster, orchestra conductor, guest lecturer.
summary:
AVAILABLE FOR WORK/LECTURES, VERSATILE ACADEMICUS, ART-SCIENTIST, MUSICIAN (PROMOVENDUS, LAST PHASE PROMOTION). 

Musician, (concert)organist, choirmaster, lecturer is looking for work as a teacher/ docent and/or in the academic or cultural field, or in any direction where he can show his qualities, looking for challenges using his academic skills, broadening his working expertise in fields like f.i. cultural management, teaching, mentality science. Momentally working as a consultant and a ethnomusicologist, (concert)organist, choirmaster, singer. Information for an employer: this guy loves multi-tasking, paperwork, archives and besides that law.

AVAILABLE FOR LECTURES:
Prices:
The rates for non-profit organizations and cultural institutions differ from those for companies. The rates also depend on the following factors:
a) an existing presentation (more economical) or a completely new presentation
b) the duration of a presentation
c) agreements on multiple (identical) presentations
d) the period between assignment and presentation

QUALITIES:
- painstaking precision in work.
- having a nose for analyzing complex files, rapports, mind-settings.
- flexible in difficult situations, deadlines are a challenge.

EDUCATION: 
Conservatoire Ghent, Antwerp, St.Petersburg(Russia). Research-Master of Arts (cum laude, University of Amsterdam, 2010): Hebrew, Aramaic, Yiddish, Arts (Renaissance-Art, Dutch Baroque), Cultural Musicology (the Jewish culture & music: chazzanoet, the music-subculture (klezmer), main topic: (fieldwork)research Jewish (music)culture, Brazil in the social context. 
Doctoral candidate Graduate School of Humanities, Leiden University.

WORK EXPERIENCE:
- Docent High School and University 
- consultancy mind-setting, family matters related to (semi)governmental bodies, legislation, and law.
- management
- visiting-professor of Music at the Singapore University, the Ferenc Liszt Academy, Budapest, Guest-lecturer Bern University, 2019. From 2009 until now visiting-professor at CODARTS Rotterdam and the University of Leiden teaching: Gregorian Chant and Jewish culture /music.

INTERNATIONAL EXPERIENCE AS A PERFORMING ARTIST (organ, harpsichord, professional singer and conductor):
-numerous recitals at locations like: Washington National Cathedral (four times), St. Patrick Cathedral and St Thomas-church New York, Perth Cathedral, Melbourne Cathedral, Christchurch Cathedral (NZ), Concert-halls of Hong Kong, Pretoria, Tokyo (The Bach Festival of Tokyo), The Bach Festival of Jerusalem, The Amager Old Music Festival (Denmark).

projects.title: Projectvorschlag: Wiederherstellung, Bohn synagoge-orgel, ARI synagoge in Rio de Janeiro (Diskussionen in einem vorbereitenden Stadium)
projects.description: The parnassiem of the ARI synagoge Rio de Janeiro and their chazzaniem Andre Nudelman and Oren Boljover asked me to make a pre-elementair detailed rapport, with a scientific approach to answer  questions all related with their main question: is the Bohn synagogue organ unique? Is it a Jewish musical monument? Is it worth it, even when it is on the moment in a deplorable condition, to be restored. My answers where clear. The instrument is one of the largest synagogue organs still left in the South American continent, in its origin an extremely beautiful example of a great synagoge organ,  a unique Jewish cultural heritage and it is fully worth to be restored. It is in my opinion a shame that it is held in this deplorable condition.

contributors.headline: Drs., Art Scientist, ethnomusicologist, consultancy, musician; organ, harpsichord, choirmaster, orchestra conductor, guest lecturer.

projects.title: Article: the Reformator Gaspar van der Heijden in historical perspective with the recent turmoil around the Islam and IS. On instigation and demand of the  “Scientific Journal“ De Vier Ambachten,”, by-them, not amused at all, HAVY CENSURED!
projects.description: Doing  research developing a article for a yearbook 2019 of the historical circle “de Vier Ambachten” in my regio, topic the Reformator, Gaspar van der Heijden, his dwelling in Axel and Zeeuws-Vlaanderen. I compared the Reformation in Zeeland/Flanders and the actions of the reformers in historical perspective with the turmoil around the Islam and IS. Focussing on processes of radicalism, intolerance and their effects. This historical circle has serious problems publishing articles uncensored. The main reason in my case is that my article had a well-founded criticism on a action and the ideology of the Dutch politician mr.Wilders. WHICH IDEOLOGY I STRONGLY REJECT ! 17% of the readers of this journal vote on this contradictional politician.The reason for censure is in my view a pure financial matter. Not confronting the Wilders voters with critic and making in that way more profit to sell the journal also to them. It is a serious attack on academic freedom. Totally not done! Discussions and a open debate is not tolerated by the Historical Circle „ De Vier Ambachten“. I suggested my relations and students therefore not to buy and/or read this journal. If they do I adviced them, to be very critical indeed about the “scientific” content. Given the facts in my case the journal wanted to censure my Academic article. Academic research can’t be censured, certainly not by politic feelings. A journal calling them self’s scientific, censuring, not pure on academic grounds but on arguments related with voting habits of some of their readers, is in my view not scientific at all!  So I withdraw for the Historic Circle the right to publish my article; censured!!

contributors.headline: Drs., Art Scientist, ethnomusicologist, consultancy, musician; organ, harpsichord, choirmaster, orchestra conductor, guest lecturer.

projects.title: FIDAI PROFLO (PATHOU)
projects.description: The first conference of Fidai Proflo and probably the last under this name because one of the initiators mr. de Vriend discussed to rename the group: PaThou. Overal we had a good conference with workshops and discussions about watermanagement in Somerset, London and Lewes. The organization lacked the necessary professionalism. One of the problems that appear (in my view) was a overal lack of good time-management in the program (the program was to dense). A second problem was a major overkill in every detail by one of the initiators mr. de Vriend combined with the overal lack of good timemanagement. The practical organization was not satisfying at all. Mr. de Vriend invites academics to work for the project lodging them in a youth hostel paying notting. Thats not done! In general another problem to overcome are the cultural difference between the Dutch and English mentality. The Dutch eager to proceed and earn quick money, the English patience, sometimes by the Dutch translated in slowness. A first event should be a learning moment. I learned that a general lack of good organization combined with a extreme dominant project organizer is not a condition for me to continue in this setting. To have a minimum chance of success it has to proceed in a better organizational setting with a committee that organized the practical issues.

projects.title: Initiative group Scaldis Emerge
projects.description:
It is a group that moved in the field of watermanagement and research in 
watermanagement en the possibilities and impossibilities of watermanagement in some areas in the Netherlands. 
My task is to explore, using my expertise from my fieldwork in cultural musicology and the related field of anthropology, the in en outs of the mentality of the people and their relation with watermanagement, their preconceptions and how they look against the miscellaneous aspects of watermanagement in there regio.

profile_positions.description:
Topics: 
- Jewish music and culture (klezmer, chazzanut). 
- The music of Prof. Flor Peeters.
- liturgical music of the monotheistic religions            its offspring and developments in context of the socio-economic, politic and cultural environment. 
- Organ music and organ building.
- Introductions for concerts about music, composers, music genres.
profile_positions.title: Giving lecturers, also on request.

company.name: ZZPer consultancy,  culture/change management, consulting/mediation in family matters

profile_positions.company: ZZPer consultancy,  culture/change management, consulting/mediation in family matters
profile_positions.description:
Consultancy in legal en social matters within (cultural) organisations:

- My strong point in this is focussing on the interaction or lack on interaction between the top and the work-floor. Trying to explore with a climate of listening and learning from each other. 

Consulting, mediation in family matters:

- Advising/assisting in debt structuring.

- Advising families that are confronted with problems surrounding divorce, child protection, juvenile law and the problems that are due to the great diversity of aid agencies that function moderately too poorly (in the Netherlands). 

- Assisting and representing parents where they find it necessary at (youth)agencies and in discussions between parents seeking for consensus. 

- Coaching extremely gifted pupils (hoogbegaafden) and their parents.

company.name: The Catholic society of Choirs in my regio Zeeland

volunteer_experiences.description: I worked ten years as chairman of the society representing the interest of the choirs within the diocese of Breda and the churches where they functioned. One of the main issues in this function was at that time to be a intermediär between the choirs of the region and the diocese in the early process of the reorganization of the diocese and the reducing of the numbers of churches, resulting also in a reducing of choirs. This as a part of a total budgeting process.

volunteer_experiences.role: Kandidaat kieslijst Provinciale Staten Zeeland -lid commissie samenstelling verkiezingsprogramma Provinciale Staten -wetenschappelijke adviseur SP afdeling Terneuzen in voorkomende situaties.
volunteer_experiences.description:
- Candidate Provinciale Staten Zeeland

- Expert PFas dossiers giving recently as a academicus a input in the formulating of a statement concerning the PFas pollution in the Westerschelde and the expected pollution with PFas when inundating the Hedwigepolder. Also attending on the spreading of PFas on the coasts of the Netherlands through aerosols from the seawater.

- Member of the program-committee Statenverkiezingen Zeeland.
